sentences: Vaadades linnast mägede poole, nägi ta kauneid vaateid.
Ma olen vaadates seda videot juba tundi aega.
Pärast pikka tööpäeva on meil vaadates väga väsinud.
context: 'Vaadades' is the Estonian present active participle of the verb 'vaadata', which means 'to look' or 'to watch'. It functions similarly to the English '-ing' form (present participle) and indicates that someone is in the process of looking at or watching something. This word form is commonly used as a dependent clause in Estonian sentences, often preceded by 'kui' (when) or used with other conjunctions.
